byline.contributor: Jennifer Medina reported from Los Angeles, and Tamar Lewin from New York. Ronnie Cohen contributed reporting from the Bay Area.
byline.original: By JENNIFER MEDINA and TAMAR LEWIN

abstract: Student government councils in dozens of American colleges have passed resolutions urging school administrations to divest from companies that many see as helping Israel mistreat Palestinians; resolutions are inspired by Boycotts, Divestment and Sanctions campaign; debates are emotional, with many minorities expressing solidarity with Palestinians, and supporters of Israel, worried that debates are motivated by anti-Semitism and a questioning of legitimacy of Israel itself.
lead_paragraph: Student groups nationwide are proposing that their colleges divest from companies that do business with Israel, a sign that a campaign is gaining traction.

headline.main: Campus Debates on Israel Drive a Wedge Between Jews and Minorities
headline.print_headline: Views on Israel Drive a Wedge in Campus Life

snippet: Student groups nationwide are proposing that their colleges divest from companies that do business with Israel, a sign that a campaign is gaining traction.
